body.p:
BOSTON, MA-- Title brainstorm ideas: ---Incredible! Student manages to watch entire Game of Thrones series during Chemistry Lectures funny https://www.michigandaily.com/sites/default/files/leg/imagecache/fullnode/tmn.NEW_.classrooms.1-256-11003.jpg
---Student refrains from coughing an 8th time during class, in fear of appearing diseased relatable! https://edc2.healthtap.com/ht-staging/user_answer/reference_image/33429/large/Valsalva_maneuver.jpeg?1386672709 "He just kept coughing and the whole time I was just thinking, 'what is wrong with that guy?

footer.related_links: Great, The Uber Driver is Playing His F*cking Mixtape
Gary Johnson Claims Media Meltdown Helped His Campaign, VP Claims Otherwise

report.p:
Summary: You have several title ideas for his article. Some are relatable to Northeastern and/or college students, while others are universal to anyone.
Critique/Eval: Titles are the most important part of these satirical articles, so I think it is understandable that you only have titles to be reviewed. I definitely favor some over the others, and I also like the idea of doing an article that is related to college. My favorite is the Game of Thrones one. If you were to use that one, I would suggest omitting “only” and “his” so it reads” Incredible! Student Manages to Watch Entire Game of Thrones Series During Chemistry Lectures.” It is not a big deal, but I think it just sounds a little bit more synthesized. I do really like the “Incredible!” because it reflects The Onion’s wording. You could sarcastically comment on the tuition money being wasted, quotes from other students in his class, etc.
I also liked the other college-themed titles, including the ResLife one and the coughing one. It is really just a matter of figuring out how to elaborate on them. I also like the “Scientists Agree That Pigs Will Likely Never Fly.” I think that is a really clever title, and gets to the type of humor Onion has in some of its random/wtf articles that satirize a random part of society, like the saying “when pigs fly.” The athlete/rape one is definitely a relevant topic in society, but maybe overdone/time already passed. The computer science one is also really funny, but maybe only really relevant to a small crowd (computer science majors), which isn’t a huge deal, just something to consider. The Harambe one is actually kind of funny even though I think Harambe jokes should've never been a thing. But the title is funny mainly because I think someone could actually believe it. The Gary Johnson one is also funny, so it is just a matter of being able to elaborate
Overall, you presented a wide range of article titles that touch upon different types of humor that come from The Onion. My suggestion would be to maybe pick a couple titles to write articles for, then decide which one comes out stronger.
